hints.content: The mass of the box of cookies is $\greenD{263}$ grams.
The mass of the brownies is $\maroonD{572}$ grams.

We can find the total mass of the desserts by adding the mass of the box of cookies $( \greenD{263\text{ g}})$  to the mass of the brownies $( \maroonD{572\text{ g}})$.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total mass. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The shorter left part is labeled 263 grams. The longer right part is labeled 572 grams. A curved bracket across the shorter left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Cookies. A curved bracket across the longer right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Brownies. !

hints.content: The mass of the desserts combined is $835$ grams.

question.content:
Jessica is making desserts. One box of cookies weighs $263$ grams. The brownies weigh $572$ grams.

**How much do both of the desserts weigh combined?** 
 
[[☃ input-number 2]] grams
